summary: This is a formal request from an Assistant United States Attorney at the SDNY Public Corruption Unit to the NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner for the complete medical examiner case file, including the autopsy report and all photographs, related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It establishes official interest in the circumstances of Epstein's death shortly after it occurred.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the medical examiner records request; his death is the case being investigated.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The official from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit who is submitting the request for Jeffrey Epstein's medical examiner records.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: SDNY Requests Epstein Autopsy Records
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York formally requests the complete medical examiner case file for Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner, 421 East 26th Street, New York, New York 10016
US Attorneys Office, SDNY Public Corruption Unit, 1 St. Andrews Pl., NY, NY 10007
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (implied location of death)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) Public Corruption Unit formally requested Jeffrey Epstein's complete medical examiner records on August 19, 2019.
The request was made just nine days after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating a prompt official investigation into the circumstances.
The request specifically asks for the autopsy report, the complete case file, and all photographs, showing a comprehensive investigative scope.
The request originates from the Public Corruption Unit, which may suggest the investigation was considering broader implications beyond a simple death in custody.
